segment.source: This topic for the IT professional describes the Advanced Security Audit policy setting, Audit Filtering Platform Connection, which determines whether the operating system generates audit events when connections are allowed or blocked by the Windows Filtering Platform.
segment.target: This topic for the IT professional describes the Advanced Security Audit policy setting, Audit Filtering Platform Connection, which determines whether the operating system generates audit events when connections are allowed or blocked by the Windows Filtering Platform.

segment.source: Audit Filtering Platform Connection determines whether the operating system generates audit events when connections are allowed or blocked by the Windows Filtering Platform.
segment.target: Audit Filtering Platform Connection determines whether the operating system generates audit events when connections are allowed or blocked by the Windows Filtering Platform.

segment.source: Windows Filtering Platform (WFP) enables independent software vendors (ISVs) to filter and modify TCP/IP packets, monitor or authorize connections, filter Internet Protocol security (IPsec)-protected traffic, and filter remote procedure calls (RPCs).
segment.target: Windows Filtering Platform (WFP) enables independent software vendors (ISVs) to filter and modify TCP/IP packets, monitor or authorize connections, filter Internet Protocol security (IPsec)-protected traffic, and filter remote procedure calls (RPCs).

segment.source: This subcategory contains Windows Filtering Platform events about blocked and allowed connections, blocked and allowed port bindings, blocked and allowed port listening actions, and blocked to accept incoming connections applications.
segment.target: This subcategory contains Windows Filtering Platform events about blocked and allowed connections, blocked and allowed port bindings, blocked and allowed port listening actions, and blocked to accept incoming connections applications.

segment.source: Success auditing for this subcategory typically generates a very high volume of events, for example, one event for every connection that was made to the system.
segment.target: Success auditing for this subcategory typically generates a very high volume of events, for example, one event for every connection that was made to the system.

segment.source: It is much more important to audit Failure events (blocked connections, for example).
segment.target: It is much more important to audit Failure events (blocked connections, for example).

segment.source: For recommendations for using and analyzing the collected information, see the Security Monitoring Recommendations sections.
segment.target: For recommendations for using and analyzing the collected information, see the Security Monitoring Recommendations sections.

segment.source: IF - Enable Success audit in case you need to monitor successful outbound or inbound connections to and from untrusted IP addresses on high value computers or devices.
segment.target: IF - Enable Success audit in case you need to monitor successful outbound or inbound connections to and from untrusted IP addresses on high value computers or devices.

segment.source: Success auditing for this subcategory typically generates a very high volume of events, for example, one event for every connection that was made to the system.
segment.target: Success auditing for this subcategory typically generates a very high volume of events, for example, one event for every connection that was made to the system.

segment.source: It is much more important to audit Failure events (blocked connections, for example).
segment.target: It is much more important to audit Failure events (blocked connections, for example).

segment.source: For recommendations for using and analyzing the collected information, see the Security Monitoring Recommendations sections.
segment.target: For recommendations for using and analyzing the collected information, see the Security Monitoring Recommendations sections.

segment.source: IF - Enable Success audit in case you need to monitor successful outbound or inbound connections to and from untrusted IP addresses on high value computers or devices.
segment.target: IF - Enable Success audit in case you need to monitor successful outbound or inbound connections to and from untrusted IP addresses on high value computers or devices.

segment.source: Success auditing for this subcategory typically generates a very high volume of events, for example, one event for every connection that was made to the system.
segment.target: Success auditing for this subcategory typically generates a very high volume of events, for example, one event for every connection that was made to the system.

segment.source: It is much more important to audit Failure events (blocked connections, for example).
segment.target: It is much more important to audit Failure events (blocked connections, for example).

segment.source: For recommendations for using and analyzing the collected information, see the Security Monitoring Recommendations sections.
segment.target: For recommendations for using and analyzing the collected information, see the Security Monitoring Recommendations sections.

segment.source: IF - Enable Success audit in case you need to monitor successful outbound or inbound connections to and from untrusted IP addresses on high value computers or devices.
segment.target: IF - Enable Success audit in case you need to monitor successful outbound or inbound connections to and from untrusted IP addresses on high value computers or devices.

segment.source: 5031(F): The Windows Firewall Service blocked an application from accepting incoming connections on the network.
segment.target: 5031(F): The Windows Firewall Service blocked an application from accepting incoming connections on the network.

segment.source: 5150(-): The Windows Filtering Platform blocked a packet.
segment.target: 5150(-): The Windows Filtering Platform blocked a packet.

segment.source: 5151(-): A more restrictive Windows Filtering Platform filter has blocked a packet.
segment.target: 5151(-): A more restrictive Windows Filtering Platform filter has blocked a packet.

segment.source: 5154(S): The Windows Filtering Platform has permitted an application or service to listen on a port for incoming connections.
segment.target: 5154(S): The Windows Filtering Platform has permitted an application or service to listen on a port for incoming connections.

segment.source: 5155(F): The Windows Filtering Platform has blocked an application or service from listening on a port for incoming connections.
segment.target: 5155(F): The Windows Filtering Platform has blocked an application or service from listening on a port for incoming connections.

segment.source: 5156(S): The Windows Filtering Platform has permitted a connection.
segment.target: 5156(S): The Windows Filtering Platform has permitted a connection.

segment.source: 5157(F): The Windows Filtering Platform has blocked a connection.
segment.target: 5157(F): The Windows Filtering Platform has blocked a connection.

segment.source: 5158(S): The Windows Filtering Platform has permitted a bind to a local port.
segment.target: 5158(S): The Windows Filtering Platform has permitted a bind to a local port.

segment.source: 5159(F): The Windows Filtering Platform has blocked a bind to a local port.
segment.target: 5159(F): The Windows Filtering Platform has blocked a bind to a local port.
